personalInfo.name: Şehra Sinejan Eser
personalInfo.title: Cloud/AI Engineer
personalInfo.bio: Cloud Engineer and tech enthusiast focused on optimizing AWS infrastructure and automating system management. I'm also expanding my skills through advanced AI/ML training, actively developing and delivering AI-powered solutions that integrate cloud technologies, DevOps practices, and intelligent automation to build smarter, more efficient systems.

responsibilities: Managed and supported cloud infrastructure using AWS managed services, optimizing deployments, automating configurations, and implementing Infrastructure as Code to streamline operations
Executed CI/CD pipelines, monitored cloud systems using advanced observability and monitoring tools, and resolved complex issues to accelerate development and deployment processes
Migrated production environments from on-premises to cloud with zero downtime, ensuring seamless transitions and operational continuity
Developed and deployed AI-driven solutions, including custom agentic chatbots and intelligent document processing pipelines, to enhance business workflows
Trained anomaly detection models for a major telecommunications company and presented results to leadership, contributing to strategic decision-making in cloud operations
Delivered resource discovery and inventory management for Azure services, documenting architecture, dependencies, configurations, and readiness gaps for AWS migration
Part of the team that supported Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) modeling and business case development by gathering stakeholder requirements
Contributed to developing a migration plan and readiness assessment report
Used Python programming and performed simple analysis using Tableau
Gained basic knowledge of data analytics processes

projects.title: AWS SageMaker RCF Multi-Server Anomaly Detection
projects.description: Built an enterprise-grade anomaly detection system using AWS SageMaker's Random Cut Forest algorithm to analyze system metrics across multiple servers with automated serverless deployment.
highlights: Analyzed comprehensive system metrics including CPU, memory, disk I/O, network, and load across multiple servers
Trained Random Cut Forest model with optimized parameters for accurate anomaly detection
Deployed serverless endpoint with statistical threshold optimization for real-time detection
Implemented batch processing pipeline for efficient large-scale data analysis
Presented system demo and results to client cloud department leadership
projects.outcome: Delivered production-ready anomaly detection system with automated pipeline, enabling proactive infrastructure monitoring and issue detection

projects.title: AI-Powered HR Analytics System
projects.description: Built an LLM-powered HR analytics platform using Amazon Bedrock that transforms natural language queries into actionable data insights from MongoDB, enabling HR teams to access complex analytics through conversational queries.
highlights: Integrated Amazon Bedrock with Claude 3.5 Sonnet for natural language understanding and query processing
Built dual-engine architecture: simple engine for basic queries and complex engine with MongoDB aggregation pipelines
Implemented 15+ analytical query types including conversion rates, time-to-hire metrics, and demographic distributions
Achieved 70% cost reduction through multi-level caching of LLM responses and MongoDB query results
Deployed production-ready FastAPI application with streaming responses and comprehensive error handling
Optimized for Turkish language support with query processing time of 5-15 seconds and 85%+ success rate
projects.outcome: Delivered conversational analytics platform that eliminates the need for SQL knowledge, accelerating hiring decisions and improving recruitment efficiency for client HR teams

projects.title: EKS Deployment and Monitoring Project
projects.description: Set up production-ready Kubernetes environment on AWS EKS with n8n workflow automation and Open WebUI, including comprehensive monitoring and logging infrastructure.
highlights: Implemented Infrastructure as Code with Terraform for reproducible deployments
Deployed n8n workflow automation with main-worker architecture and horizontal pod autoscaling
Configured Application Load Balancer with multi-service ingress and DNS routing
Set up centralized logging with Fluentd DaemonSet forwarding to CloudWatch
Built comprehensive monitoring dashboards using Grafana, Prometheus, and OpenTelemetry
Resolved complex RBAC permissions, resource constraints, and load balancer routing challenges
projects.outcome: Delivered production-ready Kubernetes cluster with automated scaling, full observability, and centralized logging infrastructure

projects.title: Venue Discovery Chatbot with AWS Bedrock
projects.description: Developed an intelligent venue search chatbot using AWS Bedrock and Claude v2 that processes natural language queries in Turkish to extract structured search parameters for a discovery platform.
highlights: Built serverless Lambda architecture with prompt builder, Bedrock model integration, and response parsing components
Implemented Anthropic Claude v2 model with optimized parameters for consistent JSON output generation
Designed constrained prompt templates with Turkish instructions and enumerated value constraints for accurate entity extraction
Created curated data artifacts for standardized venue amenity tags and validated location fields
Developed robust error handling and request validation within the API Gateway integration
Enabled natural language search for complex queries
projects.outcome: Delivered an intelligent search interface that simplifies complex venue discovery, allowing users to find locations using natural language instead of complex forms

projects.title: On-Premise to AWS Migration
projects.description: Migrated customer's on-premise frontend and backend servers to AWS with zero downtime, implementing Infrastructure as Code and load balancing.
highlights: Coded entire AWS infrastructure with Terraform (VPC, subnets, security groups, RDS, S3, EC2)
Migrated Ubuntu servers using Rsync for file transfer
Transferred MySQL database dump to RDS with complete configuration
Configured Application Load Balancer with path-based routing (/api/docs to backend, others to frontend)
Set up health checks and achieved healthy instance status

Resolved complex debugging issues, fixed permission conflicts, restored broken database connections, optimized routing, and successfully regained access to previously restricted data after credential removal.
projects.outcome: Successfully migrated on-premise infrastructure to AWS with ALB load balancing, optimized routing, and production-ready configuration

projects.title: AWS Rekognition Face Management System
projects.description: Developed an automated profile photo management system that maintains synchronization across Amazon S3, Rekognition Face Collection, and asset storage, ensuring consistent facial recognition and profile display.
highlights: Built automated Lambda workflow triggered by S3 events to synchronize profile photos across three storage locations
Implemented atomic synchronization with transaction-like behavior and rollback on failures
Configured Rekognition IndexFaces and DeleteFaces APIs for automatic face collection updates
Handled edge cases including multi-face detection, photos without faces, and S3 overwrite timing
Optimized costs with S3 lifecycle policies and event filtering for targeted Lambda triggers
Added dead letter queue for retry attempts and comprehensive error handling
projects.outcome: Eliminated manual synchronization operations and reduced photo inconsistency issues to zero, ensuring seamless profile updates and reliable facial recognition features

projects.title: S3 - CloudFront CI/CD Pipeline
projects.description: Built fully automated CI/CD pipeline for Next.js website using GitHub Actions, AWS S3, and CloudFront with OIDC authentication and custom domain configuration.
highlights: Configured OIDC authentication and IAM roles for secure AWS integration
Automated build, S3 sync, and CloudFront invalidation on every push
Implemented CloudFront Function for pretty URL redirects
Configured HTTPS with SSL certificate and custom domain
Restricted S3 bucket access to CloudFront service principal only
projects.outcome: Fully automated deployment pipeline: Push → Build → S3 Deploy → CloudFront Invalidation with production-ready, secure infrastructure

projects.title: S3 Presigned URL Secure Upload System
projects.description: Built secure file upload system using AWS Lambda and API Gateway to generate temporary presigned URLs for direct S3 uploads.
highlights: Created Lambda function to generate time-limited presigned URLs (15 minutes)
Configured IAM roles with S3 PutObject permissions
Integrated REST API endpoint with API Gateway
Updated S3 bucket policy to accept only presigned URL uploads
projects.outcome: Secure, scalable file upload infrastructure where clients receive temporary URLs via API for direct S3 uploads

activities: UAV TeknoFest Team - Research on ground station configuration and implementation using C#

volunteerWork.description: AWS Cloud Club in Istanbul brings together cloud computing enthusiasts. We organize events and workshops using AWS services.

Google Developer Student Clubs (GDSC) is a university-based community for students interested in Google developer technologies. As a member of the GDSC Core Team, my role involves being responsible for the planning, coordination, and execution of Google technology-focused events.

Öğrenci Kariyeri is the largest event program in Türkiye dedicated to university students. It aims to bring together professionals working in key departments of leading Turkish companies such as TUSAŞ, Turkcell, Havelsan, both in physical and online environments, focusing on a specific theme.

mentorships.program: Republic Of Türkiye Ministry of Industry and Technology - Artificial Intelligence Specialization Program
mentorships.description: After completing foundational training, I was selected among 120 participants for an advanced AI specialization program, receiving training and project guidance from experts at leading organizations like Cezeri and TÜBİTAK.
With my mentor Alex Güensche, I am gaining knowledge about AWS and career planning with the guidance while also preparing for the AWS certification.
I participated in the AWS Cloud Women Mentorship Program, where my mentor, Ashish Jagtap, helped me improve my skills and career planning.
I was part of Sufle.io's mentorship program with mentor Ekrem Ağca. Sufle is a Amazon partner in Turkey.

skills: AWS Managed Services (ECS, Lambda, EKS, EC2, S3)
